Class Customer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Customer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Customer>
    public class Customer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Customer>
    A Customer enters the shop, and if possible, gets served immediately else waits if there isn't anyone else waiting else Customer leaves.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Customer

        private Customer​(int myID,
                 double timing)
        Constructs a Customer when the Customer enters.
        Parameters:
        myID - each customer has a unique customer ID
        timing - refers to the timing when the status "arrives" is assigned to the customer

      • Customer

        private Customer​(int myID,
                 double timing,
                 double nextTiming,
                 java.lang.String customerStatus,
                 int serverID)
        Constructs a customer whenever there's a state change.
        Parameters:
        myID - each customer has a unique customer ID.
        timing - refers to the timing when the current status of the customer was assigned.
        nextTiming - when the customer is expected to leave.
        customerStatus - what the customer's current status is.

    • Method Detail

      • enter

        public static Customer enter​(double arrivalTime)
        Generates a customer when the someone enters. Customer's status is "arrives".
        Parameters:
        arrivalTime - when the customer entered the establishment
        Returns:
        Customer the newly arrived customer

      • updateStatus

        public Customer updateStatus​(double newTiming,
                             double nextTiming,
                             java.lang.String myNewStatus,
                             int serverID)
        Returns a new instance of Customer when there's a state change.
        Parameters:
        newTiming - the timing when the customer's status changed.
        nextTiming - when the customer is expected to leave.
        myNewStatus - the newly assigned status of the customer.
        Returns:
        Customer customer with newly changed state.

      • immediatelyGetServed

        protected Customer immediatelyGetServed​(int serverID,
                                        double serviceDuration)
        Customer served upon arrival. State change: ARRIVES to SERVED
        Returns:
        Customer Customer that gets served.

      • done

        protected Customer done()
        Customer is served and hence is done. State change: SERVED to DONE
        Returns:
        Customer Customer that is done.

      • wait

        protected Customer wait​(double nextAvailableTime,
                        int serverID)
        Customer waits if there's no one else waiting and the service isn't available. State change: ARRIVES to WAITS
        Parameters:
        nextAvailableTime - the next time that anyone can be served at
        Returns:
        Customer Customer that waits.

      • doneWaiting

        protected Customer doneWaiting​(int serverID,
                               double serviceDuration)
        Customer is done waiting and is ready to be served. State change: WAITS to SERVED
        Returns:
        Customer Customer that is done waiting and will be served next.

      • leave

        protected Customer leave()
        Customer decides to leave if there's already someone waiting and the service isn't available. State change: ARRIVES to LEAVES
        Returns:
        Customer Customer that leaves.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Customer otherCustomer)
        Determines the ordering of the Customers within the Priority Queue. Ordered by their respective timings, and if tied, by their IDs.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Customer>
        Parameters:
        otherCustomer - another Customer to be compared to be ordered within the priority queue of customers.
        Returns:
        int priority score.
